subject: Politics
title: Public Choice Theory
description: A quick win: understand Public Choice Theory.

hook.text: Politicians claim to serve the public. Public choice theory says they serve themselves â€” just like everyone else.

buildup.text: Public choice applies economic thinking to politics. Politicians maximize votes, not the common good.

discovery.text: James Buchanan won the Nobel Prize for showing government failure is as real as market failure.

twist.text: Bureaucracies grow because bureaucrats benefit from bigger budgets, not because the public needs more services.

climax.text: Public choice explains why bad policies survive. Concentrated benefits beat diffuse costs every time.

punchline.text: Self-interest doesn't stop at the government door. Politicians are human too.

quiz.question: What does public choice theory argue?
options: Politicians and bureaucrats act in their own self-interest, just like market participants
Government officials always prioritize public welfare
Markets always produce better outcomes than governments
